H0.text: Producers are the organisms that eat only plants.

H1.text: Omnivores are organisms that eat only plants.

H2.text: Herbivores are organisms that eat only plants.

H3.text: Scavengers are organisms that eat only plants.

A4.text: These more broadly also encompass animals that eat non-vascular autotrophs such as mosses, algae and lichens, but do not include those feeding on decomposed plant matters (i.e. detritivores) or macrofungi (i.e. fungivores).

A5.text: Omnivores can obtain their nutrients from either plants or animals.

A6.text: The herbivore defenses of Senecio viscusus
